p: In summary, under the six possible future climate scenarios, D. involucrata in south-central and southwestern China would suffer from substantial losses of potential habitats (with an average of nearly 57%), although the remaining areas are included within the current potential distribution area ( Figs 7 and 8, Table 1). To a limited extent, and especially for the RCP 8.5 scenario, D. involucrata would shift further to the west (such a shift is much more evident when uncertainty is not taken into account; Supplementary Figs S1Zeâ€“Zm). We must thus expect a decline in areal extent of suitable habitats for this species as global climate change progresses.
